net.jxta.impl.content
Class ModuleLifecycleManager<T extends Module>

java.lang.Object
  net.jxta.impl.content.ModuleLifecycleManager<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Module type to be managed
public class ModuleLifecycleManager<T extends Module>
extends Object

Manages the lifecycle of a set of subordinate Modules such that a goal state can be set and the subordinate Modules will make their way toward the goal state using the semantics defined by the return value of Module.startApp(). Although the API presented by this class has the ability to manage Modules spanning more than one PeerGroup, the intent is for a manager instance to be created per peer group, allowing the entire set of Modules in the PeerGroup to be centrally managed by a single control point.

addModule

public void addModule(T subordinate,
                      PeerGroup peerGroup,
                      ID assignedID,
                      Advertisement advertisement,
                      String[] args)
Adds the Module provided. Once it has been added, it will start progressing toward the current master state.

Parameters:
subordinate - the Module to be managed
peerGroup - the PeerGroup within which the master Module is operating.
assignedID - the ID assigned to this Module
advertisement - the Module's advertisement
args - arguments to pass to the tracker when it is started

removeModule

public void removeModule(Module subordinate,
                         boolean stopFirst)
Removes the specified Module from the auspices of the manager.

Parameters:
subordinate - the previously added Module which should be removed from the tracked Module list
stopFirst - set to true if the Module should always be returned to a stopped state, false to leave the Module in it's current state

list of ModuleLifecycleTrackers

getModuleCount

public int getModuleCount()
Convenience method to obtain the total number of Modules being tracked.

Returns:
number of tracked Modules

getGoalState

public ModuleLifecycleState getGoalState()
Gets the current goal state. This is the state which all suboridnate modules are attempting to get to, though they may not all be at this state.

Returns:
current goal state

getModuleCountInGoalState

public int getModuleCountInGoalState()
Returns the number of subordinate modules that are currently at the goal state. This method knows to check the ModuleLifecycle state's isInitialized and isStarted methods to match the intent of the goal state.

Returns:
number of subordinate Modules in the goal state
